definition-item.definition-title: CAPSTANS; WINCHES; TACKLES, e.g. PULLEY BLOCKS; HOISTS (winding or unwinding ropes or cables for feeding or storage purposes B65H; rope or cable winding or unwinding mechanisms for lifts B66B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Rope, cable or chain winding or unwinding mechanisms for moving all loads except lift cages, e.g. winches for dredges; braking or detent devices characterised by their application for retarding or preventing rotary movement of a winding drum or barrel
IPC group B66D1/395 is not used in the internal ECLA classification scheme. Subject matter covered by this group is classified in the following ECLA groups: B66D1/36, B66D1/50

table-column.paragraph-text: Winding or unwinding ropes or cables for feeding or storage purposes
Cable winding or unwinding mechanisms for lifts
Winding units specially adapted for drilling operations

definition-item.definition-title: Rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms; Capstans (portable or mobile lifting or hauling appliances B66D3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Rope, cable or chain winding or unwinding mechanisms for moving all loads except lift cages, e.g. Winches for dredges;

table-column.paragraph-text: Portable or mobile lifting or hauling appliances

section-body.paragraph-text: Documents should be classified in the lowest subgroup possible and only classified in higher groups if none of the subgroups is applicable. If necessary documents should be classified in multiple subgroups. All non-trivial technical features should be classified. Main groups should only be used when no appropriate subgroup exists.

Drives using for example springs, see for example US 4 009 843

definition-item.definition-title: Power transmissions between power sources and drums or barrels {(including brakes, one-way brakes, one-way clutches, clutches activated alternately with brakes, fixed ratio gearing unless otherwise provided for in B66D1/16 - B66D1/24)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Including brakes, one-way brakes, one-way clutches, clutches activated alternately with brakes, fixed ratio gearing unless otherwise provided for in B66D1/16 - B66D1/24

definition-item.definition-title: the drums or barrels being freely rotatable {, e.g. having a clutch activated independently of a brake (B66D1/20, B66D1/22, B66D1/24 take precedence; clutches activated alternately with brakes B66D1/14, slip couplings B66D1/14)}

section-body.paragraph-text: E.g. having a clutch activated independently of a brake (B66D1/20, B66D1/22, B66D1/24 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: An engine e.g. an internal combustion engine on a motor vehicle or a portable winch
